meanings.definition: To have a mutual relationship or connection with something else.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys corelating with her classmates during group projects.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often use graphs to show how different variables corelate with each other.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog corelate so well, they even nap together.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music corelates with her passion for dancing.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting corelate beautifully, creating a harmonious composition.

meanings.definition: To show a connection or relationship between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: The detective is corelating the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: The study aims to corelate the effects of exercise on mental health.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce corelates the flavors of the dish perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile corelates with her positive attitude towards life.
meanings.sent5: The map corelates the locations of all the historical landmarks in the city.

meanings.definition: To be in correspondence or agreement with something else.
meanings.sent1: His actions corelate with his words, showing his sincerity.
meanings.sent2: The results of the experiment corelate with the hypothesis proposed.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast corelates with the reality outside.
meanings.sent4: Her values corelate with her ethical beliefs, guiding her decisions.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces corelate perfectly, forming a complete picture.
